ins.il: present tense and past tense, all persons

dt: {bc}be urged to {bc}ought by all means to
{bc}be required by immediate or future need or purpose to

dt.t: we {wi}must{/wi} hurry to catch the bus

dt: {bc}be obliged to {bc}be compelled by social considerations to
{bc}be required by law, custom, or moral conscience {dx_def}see {dxt|conscience||1}{/dx_def} to

dt.t: if you {wi}must{/wi} go at least wait for me

dt: {bc}be compelled by fate or by {d_link|natural law|natural law} to
{bc}was or were {d_link|presumably|presumably} certain to {bc}was or were bound to

dt.t: if he did it she {wi}must{/wi} have known

et: Middle English {it}moste{/it}, from Old English {it}mōste{/it}, past indicative & subjunctive of {it}mōtan{/it} to be allowed to, have to; akin to Old High German {it}muozan{/it} to be allowed to, have to
shortdef: be urged to : ought by all means to
be compelled by physical necessity to : be required by immediate or future need or purpose to
an imperative need or duty : requirement

dt: {bc}the expressed juice of fruit and especially grapes before and during fermentation
{bc}the pulp and skins of the crushed grapes

et: Middle English, from Old English, from Latin {it}mustum{/it}
shortdef: the expressed juice of fruit and especially grapes before and during fermentation; also : the pulp and skins of the crushed grapes

et: Middle English (Scots) {it}moist{/it}, from Middle French {it}must{/it}, alteration of {it}musc{/it} musk

dt: {bc}a periodic state of the bull elephant characterized especially by aggressive behavior and usually connected with the rutting season

shortdef: a periodic state of the bull elephant characterized especially by aggressive behavior and usually connected with the rutting season

dt: {bc}something that is essential to have or obtain

shortdef: something that is essential to have or obtain

dt: {bc}something (such as a film) that must or should be seen

shortdef: something (such as a film) that must or should be seen

dt: used to say that one will allow someone to do something even though one does not approve of it

dt.t: He can smoke {it}if he must{/it}, but he has to do it outdoors.

shortdef: —used to say that one will allow someone to do something even though one does not approve of it

dt: used when one is answering a question that one does not want to answer because the information is personal, embarrassing, etc.

dt.t: "Why did you leave that job?" "{it}If you must know{/it}, I was fired."

shortdef: —used when one is answering a question that one does not want to answer because the information is personal, embarrassing, etc.

meta.id: I must love you and leave you
stems: i must love you and leave you

hwi.hw: I must love you and leave you

dt: used to say that one has to leave

dt.t: I don't want to miss the last train, so I'm afraid {it}I must love you and leave you{/it}.

shortdef: —used to say that one has to leave
